sentences.en: "You can depend on me," Cross assured him.
sentences.cn: “你可以信赖我，”克罗斯向他保证。

sentences.en: Edwards is already crowing about his assured victory.
sentences.cn: 爱德华兹已经在为自己确定无疑的胜利自鸣得意了。

sentences.en: He assured us of his ability to solve the problem.
sentences.cn: 他向我们保证他有能力解决这个问题.

sentences.en: He spoke in a calm, assured voice.
He was infinitely more assured than in his more recent parliamentary appearances.
sentences.cn: 比起最近几次在国会中的露面，他表现得自信多了。
她的政治前途一片光明。
她重新当选似乎是十拿九稳.

sentences.en: His manner was self-assured and brusque.
I've assured him I have no plans to let him go.
sentences.cn: 我向他保证，我绝对没打算让他走人。

sentences.en: Laura Davies is assured of a place in Europe's team.
sentences.cn: 劳拉·戴维斯确信能在欧洲队中占据一席之地。

sentences.en: Rest assured, he probably has rather more common sense than you realize.
sentences.cn: 放心吧，他知道的常识很可能比你以为的要多得多。

sentences.en: Rest assured, if you owe taxes, we will collect them.
sentences.cn: 不用多想，如果你欠税，我们会去收的。

sentences.en: She assured us not to worry.
sentences.cn: 她使我们相信不用担心.

sentences.en: She did her best to appear more self-assured than she felt.
sentences.cn: 她竭力让自己表现得比实际更自信。

sentences.en: She was self-assured, poised, almost self-satisfied.
sentences.cn: 她自信、沉着，几乎有些洋洋自得。

sentences.en: You can rest assured that we will do our best.
sentences.cn: 你放心吧,我们会尽力而为的.

words.tran_cn: 保证的；确信的；使人有信心的
保证；担保；使确信；弄清楚

trans.tran_cn: 确定的，自信的，自大的，狂妄的，胆大妄为的，<英>被保了险的
trans.tran_en: certain to happen or to be achieved

trans.tran_cn: 使相信，使确信(assure的过去式)，保险，使相信，使确信(assure的过去式和过去分词)，保险
